title: 103_hr2191
content: The Act titled "Economic Development Loan Assistance Demonstration Program Act of 1993" establishes a demonstration program. The Act establishes a program to encourage economic development in enterprise zones by providing grants to community development corporations for reducing interest rates on loans. The Secretary will select 5 enterprise zones, with at least 2 in rural areas, for the demonstration program. The Secretary will select 5 enterprise zones for a demonstration program, with 2 in rural areas and 2 in metropolitan statistical areas, ensuring national geographic diversity among participating zones. SEC. 3. GRANTS FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LOAN ASSISTANCE. Under this Act, the Secretary may grant funds to community development corporations to assist businesses and nonprofit organizations in enterprise zones by reducing interest rates on loans for economic development activities. The grant amounts should not exceed a 60% reduction in interest rates. The Secretary may grant funds to community development corporations to assist businesses and nonprofit organizations in enterprise zones by reducing interest rates on loans. Actions will be taken to inform businesses and nonprofits about the availability of these loans. The Secretary will monitor grant usage and administration costs under the Act. Additionally, reports and a study will be conducted. The Secretary will submit an annual report to Congress evaluating the effectiveness of grants under the demonstration program. A study will be conducted on the effects and costs of a long-term expanded grant program, with a report due by September 31, 1996. A report on the study results and recommendations for a grant program is due by September 31, 1996. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. The term "economic development activities" includes housing construction, commercial revitalization, industrial development, business assistance, training, and job creation. An "enterprise zone" is an area designated for development. The "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. Authorization of appropriations totaling $100,000,000 for fiscal years 1994-1996 is granted to carry out the Act. The Secretary is empowered to issue necessary regulations for implementation.
